      • discardFile

        protected void discardFile(File file)
                    throws IOException
        Discards a no-longer used file. Use this as a customization hook to build such things as audit trails, etc. The base implementation just moves the file to the trash directory. It'll fail if the move fails.
        Throws:
        IOException - the base implementation doesn't throw this
        IllegalStateException - if the file cannot be moved to the trash directory

      • loadCommitRecord

                     throws IOException
        Throws:

      • load

        public SidTableSet load(CommitRecord record)
                 throws IOException
        Loads and returns the table set associated with the given commit record. Note the returned resource must eventually be closed by the caller: it's a fresh new instance with open streams on the file system.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • load

        public SidTableSet load(CommitRecord record,
               SidTableSet previous)
                 throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • loadSortedTable

        public SidTable loadSortedTable(long tableId)
                         throws IOException
        Loads an existing sorted table. If the table had some sort of header, here's where you'd handle that. The base implementation assumes no header. The caller must arrange that the returned instance be eventually closed; otherwise, a resource leak will occur.
        Returns:
        a read-only instance
        Throws:
        IOException
